climbs.name: To Boat Or Not To Be
climbs.fa: Ian Lingley, Sam Jones, Matt Jones

content.description:
This climb follows up a 90 foot less vertical wall and has some really amazing features, with no distinct crux this route just follows cobbles and dishes from bottom to top.  
 This route was bolted on lead in late January after skating across the winter.

This route is right of heart attack gully and is just left of the boulder in the water in front of the beach. There is a unique rock and make a white circle at the base of the climb.
8 bolts up to a 2 bolt rap anchor

climbs.name: You Can Only Do What You Canoe
climbs.fa: Ian Lingley, Sam Jones, Matt Jones

content.description:
This route starts on a bit of poor rock but quickly leads to solid vertical cobble pulling and is a bit more sustained compared to the other route on this wall.

This route is right of heart attack gully and is just left of the boulder in the water in front of the beach. There is a unique rock and make a white circle at the base of the climb.
8 bolts lead to a 2 bolt rap station

Minister's face is an island that is located in the middle of the Kennebecasis River with cliffs rising out of the water and reaching heights of 250 feet.  
 The cliff is a conglomerate rock comprised of granite, limestone, basalt as well as lots of other types of rock and make for a incredibly unique climbing experience. The majority of the climbing on Ministers Face will be lower angle moderates but there are a few roofs and overhung walls that could potentially have some very challenging lines.  
 This is a truly incredible cliff but with poor rock quality in places and difficult access it will take a lot of time and resources to develop this classic climbing area into the moderate mecca it will be.
